abstract: World of track and field, on eve of world championships in Beijing, is reacting to fresh and highly publicized allegations of widespread doping by Russian and Kenyan athletes; inflaming controversy is report, leaked from International Assn of Athletics Federations, indicating suspicious blood values recorded by a number of track and field's top athletes during endurance events in 2000s; officials from IAAF and International Olympic Committee are dismissing allegations, but they have become major distraction as games prepare to open.
lead_paragraph: The world track and field championships are set to begin in Beijing, which hosted the 2008 Olympics and where the talk entering the meet has hardly been about the races.

headline.main: Track and Field Returns to Center Stage, as Do Doping Concerns
headline.print_headline: A Field Test for a Sport Troubled by Doping

snippet: The world track and field championships are set to begin in Beijing, which hosted the 2008 Olympics and where the talk entering the meet has hardly been about the races.
